case_vignette: A 17-year-old boy comes to the emergency department because of a 3-day history of pain in his left wrist. That morning the pain increased and he started to have chills and malaise. Last week he had self-resolving left knee pain. He is otherwise healthy and has not had any trauma to the wrist. He recently returned from a camping trip to Minnesota. He is sexually active with one female partner, who uses a diaphragm for contraception. His temperature is 37.7°C (99.9°F). Examination shows several painless violaceous vesiculopustular lesions on the dorsum of both wrists and hands; two lesions are present on the left palm. There is swelling and erythema of the left wrist with severe tenderness to palpation and passive movement.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having pain in my left wrist for 3 days, and this morning it got worse, and I'm also feeling chills and just overall unwell.
What's your age and sex?
I'm a 17-year-old boy.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications regularly?
No, I'm otherwise healthy and I don't take any regular medications.
Is there any relevant family history of joint or autoimmune diseases?
I didn't mention anything about my family's medical history, so I don't know.
Understood. Have you recently been in close contact with anyone who has been sick?
No, I haven't mentioned being in contact with anyone sick recently.
**Final Diagnosis:** Infectious Arthritis

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got pain in my left wrist that has gotten worse today, and I've started feeling chills and a general sense of being unwell.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've been experiencing the wrist pain for 3 days, but the chills and feeling unwell just started this morning.
Do you have any other symptoms such as a rash, redness, or swelling in the wrist area?

Yes, my wrist is swollen and red, and it hurts a lot when touched or moved; there are also several painless spots with a purple hue and some with blisters on the back of both wrists and hands, and two spots on my left palm.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or are you currently taking any medications?
I'm otherwise healthy and haven't had any injuries to my wrist, and I'm not on any medications.
Is there any family history of autoimmune diseases or connective tissue disorders?
I'm not aware of any family history like that.
**Final Diagnosis:** Infectious Tenosynovitis
